intro: Mercurialis tricocca, commonly known as the three-leaf mercury. It is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and gravelly areas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine, though its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological adaptability.
